observation.output:
Testing the fix for autodoc_type_aliases with autodoc_typehints='description'
Issue: https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/...

Function signature: sphinx_doc(data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]
Function docstring: Does it work.

    Args:
        data: Does it args.

    Returns:
        Does it work in return.


=== SIMULATING ORIGINAL BEHAVIOR (without fix) ===
Recorded annotations (without fix): {'data': 'Dict[str, Any]', 'return': 'Dict[str, Any]'}

Generated field list (without fix):
Parameters: data (Dict[str, Any]) – Does it args.
Return type: Dict[str, Any]

=== SIMULATING FIXED BEHAVIOR (with fix) ===
Recorded annotations (same as before): {'data': 'Dict[str, Any]', 'return': 'Dict[str, Any]'}
Type aliases configuration: {'Dict[str, Any]': 'types.JSONObject'}

Generated field list (with fix):
Parameters: data (types.JSONObject) – Does it args.
Return type: types.JSONObject

=== COMPARISON ===
Expected behavior: types.JSONObject should appear instead of Dict[str, Any]

data:
  Before fix: Dict[str, Any]
  After fix:  types.JSONObject
  ✅ FIXED - Type alias applied correctly
return:
  Before fix: Dict[str, Any]
  After fix:  types.JSONObject
  ✅ FIXED - Type alias applied correctly

=== FINAL RESULT ===
🎉 SUCCESS: The fix correctly applies type aliases when autodoc_typehints='description'!
   - Dict[str, Any] is now replaced with types.JSONObject
   - This matches the expected behavior described in the issue
